meanings.definition: The state of being separate or distinct from others.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, each tree stood in severalty, not touching the others.
meanings.sent2: The concept of severalty is important in understanding personal space.
meanings.sent3: The idea of severalty at the party led to everyone standing far apart.
meanings.sent4: Her severalty from the group made her feel both lonely and independent.
meanings.sent5: The severalty of the islands made them seem like individual worlds.

meanings.definition: Ownership of property by one individual or entity.
meanings.sent1: The severalty of the house belonged solely to the old man.
meanings.sent2: She was proud of her severalty of the rare painting.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed severalty of the entire couch as its own.
meanings.sent4: His severalty of the land made him feel like a true landowner.
meanings.sent5: The severalty of the diamond ring made it even more precious to her.
